1.title: Sweet Justice
1.plot: Johnnie Lindsey has served 26 years, and Rocky Morris has served 13 for crimes they say they didn't commit. Now, after years of campaigning, both men are finally about to get the DNA testing that will prove whether they are innocent or guilty.

3.title: Lost Time
3.plot: Steven Phillips and Michael Wofford were convicted after eyewitness testimony said they were rapists. Both men protest their innocence - but are they telling the truth?

4.title: Innocent on Death Row?
4.plot: The Conviction Integrity Unit of Dallas County takes on its first ever Death Row case. Greg Wright is due to be executed for the brutal murder of Donna Vick. But with just days to go, another man confesses to the crime.

5.title: Moral Dilemma
5.plot: In two rape cases, one man pleads innocence whilst the second admits to rape and murder. Will the innocent be freed and the guilty executed?

6.title: Justice for All
6.plot: 17 year old Antrone Johnson was jailed for sexual assault with a minor. But 13 years on, evidence comes to light that the original conviction may be flawed. Also, can Unit boss Mike Ware bring about the first ever posthumous exoneration?

-1.title: Righting Wrongs
-1.plot: Two brothers in law are allegedly involved in a murder and rape case. DNA seems to indicate that one man may have served 22 years for the rape he didn't commit. But while he may not be the rapist - was he the murderer?

imdb.plot outline: A revolution is happening in the Texas justice system. It has always been one of the most notorious in America. Tough judges, tough sentences and a reputation for putting people away when the evidence can be shaky. But things are changing fast.
imdb.title: Dallas DNA
plot: A revolution is happening in the Texas justice system. It has always been one of the most notorious in America. Tough judges, tough sentences and a reputation for putting people away when the evidence can be shaky. But things are changing fast.
